title: Graphical user interface
data:
As well as the standard [ASCII](/wiki/ASCII "ASCII") interface, many official and unofficial **graphical user interfaces** are available for *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. This page will be a visual showcase.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"There are many, many more window ports to document, with appropriate screenshots - some are additionally outdated."*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Official ports](#Official_ports)

  - [1.1 Amiga](#Amiga)
  - [1.2 Atari ST](#Atari_ST)
  - [1.3 Curses](#Curses)
  - [1.4 Windows](#Windows)
  - [1.5 X11](#X11)
  - [1.6 Qt](#Qt)
  - [1.7 MS-DOS](#MS-DOS)
  - [1.8 Mac Nethack, the Carbon port](#Mac_Nethack.2C_the_Carbon_port)

- [2 Unofficial ports](#Unofficial_ports)

  - [2.1 Falcon's Eye](#Falcon.27s_Eye)
  - [2.2 Vulture's Eye](#Vulture.27s_Eye)
  - [2.3 glHack](#glHack)
  - [2.4 noegnud](#noegnud)
  - [2.5 NetHack 3D](#NetHack_3D)
  - [2.6 iNetHack](#iNetHack)
  - [2.7 NetHack Android](#NetHack_Android)
  - [2.8 NeWT](#NeWT)

- [3 Browser-based](#Browser-based)

  - [3.1 webhack.webhook.org](#webhack.webhook.org)
  - [3.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [3.3 nethack.dank.ninja/wstty](#nethack.dank.ninja.2Fwstty)
  - [3.4 BrowserHack](#BrowserHack)

## Official ports

### Amiga

[![](/images/thumb/f/f3/Amiganethack.png/320px-Amiganethack.png)](/wiki/File:Amiganethack.png)



NetHack 3.4.3's Amiga port, showing the hero on the first level. Running on AmigaOS 3.0 under emulation.

### Atari ST

- *Main article: [Atari](/wiki/Atari "Atari")*

[![](/images/thumb/e/e2/Nethack-hatari.png/320px-Nethack-hatari.png)](/wiki/File:Nethack-hatari.png)



NetHack 3.4.3's Atari ST port. Running on Hatari with EmuTOS.

### Curses

- *Main article: [Curses interface](/wiki/Curses_interface "Curses interface")*

[![Expanded-status.png](/images/thumb/9/96/Expanded-status.png/400px-Expanded-status.png)](/wiki/File:Expanded-status.png)



The [*NetHack* curses interface](/wiki/Curses_interface "Curses interface") is an alternate character mode interface with many features not present in the traditional tty interface.

### Windows

- *Main article: [Microsoft Windows](/wiki/Microsoft_Windows "Microsoft Windows")*

[![](/images/thumb/a/a4/Win32screenshot.PNG/320px-Win32screenshot.PNG)](/wiki/File:Win32screenshot.PNG)



NetHack 3.4.3's Win32 port, showing the hero in [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown"). Running on Windows XP.

### X11

- *Main article: [X11](/wiki/X11 "X11")*

[![](/images/thumb/1/14/Xnethack.png/320px-Xnethack.png)](/wiki/File:Xnethack.png)



NetHack 3.4.3's X11 port, showing the hero on the [Oracle level](/wiki/Oracle_\(level\) "Oracle (level)"). Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.

### Qt

*Main article: [Qt](/wiki/Qt "Qt")*

[![](/images/thumb/2/29/Sokoban-Qt.png/320px-Sokoban-Qt.png)](/wiki/File:Sokoban-Qt.png)



NetHack 3.4.3's Qt port, showing a monk in [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban"). Running on NetBSD 3.0 using blackbox.

All of the status values except turns elapsed flash green when they increase and red when they decrease - so since I just went up the stairs to Sokoban, level is red, and since I just picked up some gold and am recovering power, those are green.

### MS-DOS

[![](/images/thumb/7/7a/Nethack-qemu.png/320px-Nethack-qemu.png)](/wiki/File:Nethack-qemu.png)



NetHack tiled view on [FreeDOS](http://www.freedos.org/) under [QEMU](http://fabrice.bellard.free.fr/qemu/)

By using F3, F4, and F5, the user can switch between this view, another with narrowed tiles that makes the entire map visible, and one using [IBMgraphics](/wiki/IBMgraphics "IBMgraphics").

### Mac Nethack, the Carbon port

[![](/images/thumb/8/84/Mac_Nethack_Carbon.png/320px-Mac_Nethack_Carbon.png)](/wiki/File:Mac_Nethack_Carbon.png)



Mac Nethack Carbon port running with default settings on Mac OS X 10.5.8 PowerPC

## Unofficial ports

### Falcon's Eye

- *Main article: [Falcon's Eye](/wiki/Falcon%27s_Eye "Falcon's Eye")*

[![](/images/thumb/d/d9/Falconseye.png/320px-Falconseye.png)](/wiki/File:Falconseye.png)



Falcon's Eye 3.3.1, showing the hero on the [Oracle level](/wiki/Oracle_\(level\) "Oracle (level)"). Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.

### Vulture's Eye

- *Main article: [Vulture's Eye](/wiki/Vulture%27s_Eye "Vulture's Eye")*

[![](/images/thumb/8/80/Vultures_eye.png/320px-Vultures_eye.png)](/wiki/File:Vultures_eye.png)



Vulture's Eye for NetHack 3.4.3, showing the hero in Adjama's general store.

### glHack

- *Main article: [glHack](/wiki/GlHack "GlHack")*

[![](/images/thumb/6/64/Glhack.png/320px-Glhack.png)](/wiki/File:Glhack.png)



glHack's isometric interface, showing the hero on the first level. Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.

### noegnud

- *Main article: [noegnud](/wiki/Noegnud "Noegnud")*

* [![Noegnud1.jpg](/images/thumb/e/ed/Noegnud1.jpg/120px-Noegnud1.jpg)](/wiki/File:Noegnud1.jpg)

* [![Noegnud2.jpg](/images/thumb/d/de/Noegnud2.jpg/120px-Noegnud2.jpg)](/wiki/File:Noegnud2.jpg)

* [![Noegnud3.jpg](/images/thumb/9/9e/Noegnud3.jpg/120px-Noegnud3.jpg)](/wiki/File:Noegnud3.jpg)

* [![Noegnud4.jpg](/images/thumb/6/6e/Noegnud4.jpg/120px-Noegnud4.jpg)](/wiki/File:Noegnud4.jpg)

* [![GenocideScrollTurnOne.jpg](/images/thumb/6/6a/GenocideScrollTurnOne.jpg/120px-GenocideScrollTurnOne.jpg)](/wiki/File:GenocideScrollTurnOne.jpg)

Noegnud is a semi-3D interface for both NetHack and SLASH'EM.

### NetHack 3D

[![SS20.jpg](/images/thumb/f/fc/SS20.jpg/300px-SS20.jpg)](/wiki/File:SS20.jpg)



[NetHack 3D](http://nethack3d.sourceforge.net/) features a first-person view and supports both English and Japanese. Mac OS only.

### iNetHack

|                                                                                                                                        |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [![INetHack landscape.png](/images/thumb/5/53/INetHack_landscape.png/320px-INetHack_landscape.png)](/wiki/File:INetHack_landscape.png) |

[iNetHack](/wiki/INetHack "INetHack") is an iPhone port.[\[1\]](http://code.google.com/p/inethack/)

### NetHack Android

|                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [![Nethack-android-tileset.jpeg](/images/thumb/3/3a/Nethack-android-tileset.jpeg/140px-Nethack-android-tileset.jpeg)](/wiki/File:Nethack-android-tileset.jpeg) | [![Nethack-android-tty.jpeg](/images/thumb/0/0c/Nethack-android-tty.jpeg/140px-Nethack-android-tty.jpeg)](/wiki/File:Nethack-android-tty.jpeg) |

[NetHack Android](http://code.google.com/p/nethack-android) is a port of NetHack and Slash'EM to the Android OS. It runs as native code with an Android Java frontend. It has TTY and tileset interfaces and has some touchscreen support with context sensitive actions.

### NeWT

[NetHack With Tiles](https://bitbucket.org/clivecrous/newt/src/master/) (aka NeWT) looks and behaves like the TTY version, while still allowing tiles.

- [![](/images/thumb/8/8e/NeWT-1.png/120px-NeWT-1.png)](/wiki/File:NeWT-1.png)

  Vanilla 16x16 Tiles

- [![](/images/thumb/d/de/NeWT-2.png/120px-NeWT-2.png)](/wiki/File:NeWT-2.png)

  Text-mode

- [![](/images/thumb/2/25/NeWT-3.png/120px-NeWT-3.png)](/wiki/File:NeWT-3.png)

  Inventory

## Browser-based

### [webhack.webhook.org](http://webhack.webhook.org/)

webhack.webhook.org is a browser-based graphical front-end for [NAO](/wiki/NAO "NAO"). It uses the [dawnhack](/wiki/Dawnhack "Dawnhack") tileset, but only if the [vt\_tiledata](/wiki/Vt_tiledata "Vt tiledata") option is enabled; else it will just show [ascii](/wiki/Ascii "Ascii") graphics. At the moment, it does not work: it hangs indefinitely after hitting (c)onnect

### [UnNetHack](https://un.nethack.nu/wstty/)

At un.nethack.nu/wstty, there is a browser-based front-end for playing [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"). It is currently not working (please change this if this changes) because it is trying to connect directly to un.nethack.nu when it should connect to either us.un.nethack.nu or eu.un.nethack.nu. It offers the [geoduck](/wiki/Geoduck "Geoduck"), [unchozo32b](/index.php?title=Unchozo32b\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Unchozo32b (page does not exist)"), and [dawnhack](/wiki/Dawnhack "Dawnhack") tilesets (for UnNetHack).

### [nethack.dank.ninja/wstty](https://nethack.dank.ninja/wstty/)

At nethack.xd.cm/wstty is a webterminal that connects to [nethack.dank.ninja](/wiki/Nethack.dank.ninja "Nethack.dank.ninja"). It allows tiles if vt\_tiledata is enabled in a game that supports from that; aside from that, it will display ASCII graphics

### BrowserHack

[![Browserhack.png](/images/thumb/7/70/Browserhack.png/340px-Browserhack.png)](/wiki/File:Browserhack.png)



BrowserHack is a direct port of [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") to internet browser, featuring linking tiles to the corresponding pages at NetHack Wiki (by shift-clicking). It is playable [here](http://www.kongregate.com/games/coolwanglu/browserhack). [GitHub page](https://github.com/coolwanglu/browserhack)

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Graphical user interface

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

As well as the standard ASCII interface, many official and unofficial graphical user interfaces are available for NetHack. This page will be a visual showcase.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"There are many, many more window ports to document, with appropriate screenshots - some are additionally outdated."

Contents

  • 1 Official ports
    • 1.1 Amiga
    • 1.2 Atari ST
    • 1.3 Curses
    • 1.4 Windows
    • 1.5 X11
    • 1.6 Qt
    • 1.7 MS-DOS
    • 1.8 Mac Nethack, the Carbon port
  • 2 Unofficial ports
    • 2.1 Falcon's Eye
    • 2.2 Vulture's Eye
    • 2.3 glHack
    • 2.4 noegnud
    • 2.5 NetHack 3D
    • 2.6 iNetHack
    • 2.7 NetHack Android
    • 2.8 NeWT
  • 3 Browser-based
    • 3.1 webhack.webhook.org
    • 3.2 UnNetHack
    • 3.3 nethack.dank.ninja/wstty
    • 3.4 BrowserHack

Official ports

Amiga

NetHack 3.4.3's Amiga port, showing the hero on the first level. Running on AmigaOS 3.0 under emulation.

Atari ST

Main article: Atari
NetHack 3.4.3's Atari ST port. Running on Hatari with EmuTOS.

Curses

Main article: Curses interface

The NetHack curses interface is an alternate character mode interface with many features not present in the traditional tty interface.

Windows

Main article: Microsoft Windows
NetHack 3.4.3's Win32 port, showing the hero in Minetown. Running on Windows XP.

X11

Main article: X11
NetHack 3.4.3's X11 port, showing the hero on the Oracle level. Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.

Qt

Main article: Qt

NetHack 3.4.3's Qt port, showing a monk in Sokoban. Running on NetBSD 3.0 using blackbox.

All of the status values except turns elapsed flash green when they increase and red when they decrease - so since I just went up the stairs to Sokoban, level is red, and since I just picked up some gold and am recovering power, those are green.

MS-DOS

NetHack tiled view on FreeDOS under QEMU

By using F3, F4, and F5, the user can switch between this view, another with narrowed tiles that makes the entire map visible, and one using IBMgraphics.

Mac Nethack, the Carbon port

Mac Nethack Carbon port running with default settings on Mac OS X 10.5.8 PowerPC

Unofficial ports

Falcon's Eye

Main article: Falcon's Eye
Falcon's Eye 3.3.1, showing the hero on the Oracle level. Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.

Vulture's Eye

Main article: Vulture's Eye
Vulture's Eye for NetHack 3.4.3, showing the hero in Adjama's general store.

glHack

Main article: glHack
glHack's isometric interface, showing the hero on the first level. Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.

noegnud

Main article: noegnud

Noegnud is a semi-3D interface for both NetHack and SLASH'EM.

NetHack 3D

NetHack 3D features a first-person view and supports both English and Japanese. Mac OS only.

iNetHack

iNetHack is an iPhone port.[1]

NetHack Android

NetHack Android is a port of NetHack and Slash'EM to the Android OS. It runs as native code with an Android Java frontend. It has TTY and tileset interfaces and has some touchscreen support with context sensitive actions.

NeWT

NetHack With Tiles (aka NeWT) looks and behaves like the TTY version, while still allowing tiles.

  • Vanilla 16x16 Tiles

  • Text-mode

  • Inventory

Browser-based

webhack.webhook.org

webhack.webhook.org is a browser-based graphical front-end for NAO. It uses the dawnhack tileset, but only if the vt_tiledata option is enabled; else it will just show ascii graphics. At the moment, it does not work: it hangs indefinitely after hitting (c)onnect

UnNetHack

At un.nethack.nu/wstty, there is a browser-based front-end for playing UnNetHack. It is currently not working (please change this if this changes) because it is trying to connect directly to un.nethack.nu when it should connect to either us.un.nethack.nu or eu.un.nethack.nu. It offers the geoduck, unchozo32b, and dawnhack tilesets (for UnNetHack).


nethack.dank.ninja/wstty

At nethack.xd.cm/wstty is a webterminal that connects to nethack.dank.ninja. It allows tiles if vt_tiledata is enabled in a game that supports from that; aside from that, it will display ASCII graphics

BrowserHack

BrowserHack is a direct port of NetHack to internet browser, featuring linking tiles to the corresponding pages at NetHack Wiki (by shift-clicking). It is playable here. GitHub page

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Graphical_user_interface&oldid=176787"

rawPage:
As well as the standard [[ASCII]] interface, many official and unofficial '''graphical user interfaces''' are available for ''[[NetHack]]''. This page will be a visual showcase.

{{todo|There are many, many more window ports to document, with appropriate screenshots - some are additionally outdated.}}

==Official ports==

===Amiga===

[[Image:Amiganethack.png|thumbnail|center|320px|NetHack 3.4.3's Amiga port, showing the hero on the first level. Running on AmigaOS 3.0 under emulation.]]

===Atari ST===
{{main|Atari}}

[[Image:Nethack-hatari.png|thumbnail|center|320px|NetHack 3.4.3's Atari ST port. Running on Hatari with EmuTOS.]]

===Curses===
{{main|Curses interface}}

[[File:Expanded-status.png|thumb|center|400px]]
The [[Curses interface|''NetHack'' curses interface]] is an alternate character mode interface with many features not present in the traditional tty interface.

===Windows===
{{main|Microsoft Windows}}

[[Image:Win32screenshot.PNG|thumbnail|center|320px|NetHack 3.4.3's Win32 port, showing the hero in [[Minetown]]. Running on Windows XP.]]

===X11===
{{main|X11}}

[[Image:Xnethack.png|thumbnail|center|320px|NetHack 3.4.3's X11 port, showing the hero on the [[Oracle (level)|Oracle level]]. Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.]]

===Qt===
''Main article: [[Qt]]''

[[Image:Sokoban-Qt.png|thumbnail|center|320px|NetHack 3.4.3's Qt port, showing a monk in [[Sokoban]]. Running on NetBSD 3.0 using blackbox.]]
All of the status values except turns elapsed flash green when they increase and red when they decrease - so since I just went up the stairs to Sokoban, level is red, and since I just picked up some gold and am recovering power, those are green.

===MS-DOS===
[[Image:nethack-qemu.png|thumbnail|center|320px|NetHack tiled view on [http://www.freedos.org/ FreeDOS] under [http://fabrice.bellard.free.fr/qemu/ QEMU]]]

By using F3, F4, and F5, the user can switch between this view, another with narrowed tiles that makes the entire map visible, and one using [[IBMgraphics]].

===Mac Nethack, the Carbon port===

[[Image:Mac_Nethack_Carbon.png|thumbnail|center|320px|Mac Nethack Carbon port running with default settings on Mac OS X 10.5.8 PowerPC]]

==Unofficial ports==

===Falcon's Eye===
{{main|Falcon's Eye}}

[[Image:Falconseye.png|thumbnail|center|320px|Falcon's Eye 3.3.1, showing the hero on the [[Oracle (level)|Oracle level]]. Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.]]

===Vulture's Eye===
{{main|Vulture's Eye}}

[[Image:Vultures_eye.png|thumbnail|center|320px|Vulture's Eye for NetHack 3.4.3, showing the hero in Adjama's general store.]]

===glHack===
{{main|glHack}}

[[Image:Glhack.png|thumbnail|center|320px|glHack's isometric interface, showing the hero on the first level. Running on Kubuntu Linux 6.06.]]

===noegnud===
{{main|noegnud}}

<gallery>
Image:Noegnud1.jpg
Image:Noegnud2.jpg
Image:Noegnud3.jpg
Image:Noegnud4.jpg
Image:GenocideScrollTurnOne.jpg
</gallery>

Noegnud is a semi-3D interface for both NetHack and SLASH'EM.

===NetHack 3D===

[[File:SS20.jpg|thumb|center]]

[http://nethack3d.sourceforge.net/ NetHack 3D] features a first-person view and supports both English and Japanese. Mac OS only.

===iNetHack===

{|align="center"
|[[Image:iNetHack landscape.png|thumbnail|center|320px]]
|}
[[iNetHack]] is an iPhone port.[http://code.google.com/p/inethack/]

===NetHack Android===
{|align="center"
|[[Image:Nethack-android-tileset.jpeg|thumbnail|center|140px]]
|[[Image:Nethack-android-tty.jpeg|thumbnail|center|140px]]
|}[http://code.google.com/p/nethack-android NetHack Android] is a port of NetHack and Slash'EM to the Android OS.  It runs as native code with an Android Java frontend.  It has TTY and tileset interfaces and has some touchscreen support with context sensitive actions.

===NeWT===
[https://bitbucket.org/clivecrous/newt/src/master/ NetHack With Tiles] (aka NeWT) looks and behaves like the TTY version, while still allowing tiles.

<gallery>
Image:NeWT-1.png|Vanilla 16x16 Tiles
Image:NeWT-2.png|Text-mode
Image:NeWT-3.png|Inventory
</gallery>

==Browser-based==

===[http://webhack.webhook.org/ webhack.webhook.org]===
webhack.webhook.org is a browser-based graphical front-end for [[NAO]].  It uses the [[dawnhack]] tileset, but only if the [[vt_tiledata]] option is enabled; else it will just show [[ascii]] graphics.  At the moment, it does not work: it hangs indefinitely after hitting (c)onnect

===[https://un.nethack.nu/wstty/ UnNetHack]===
At un.nethack.nu/wstty, there is a browser-based front-end for playing [[UnNetHack]].  It is currently not working (please change this if this changes) because it is trying to connect directly to un.nethack.nu when it should connect to either us.un.nethack.nu or eu.un.nethack.nu.  It offers the [[geoduck]], [[unchozo32b]], and [[dawnhack]] tilesets (for UnNetHack).


===[https://nethack.dank.ninja/wstty/ nethack.dank.ninja/wstty]===
At nethack.xd.cm/wstty is a webterminal that connects to [[nethack.dank.ninja]].  It allows tiles if vt_tiledata is enabled in a game that supports from that; aside from that, it will display ASCII graphics

===BrowserHack===
[[file:browserhack.png|thumbnail|center|340px]]BrowserHack is a direct port of [[NetHack]] to internet browser, featuring linking tiles to the corresponding pages at NetHack Wiki (by shift-clicking). It is playable [http://www.kongregate.com/games/coolwanglu/browserhack here].  [https://github.com/coolwanglu/browserhack GitHub page]

{{slashem-7E7|offset=1}}
